history.content:
This coming summer, Marvin Zhang and I will be co-instructing CS 61A, and we’re looking for qualified TAs to do all of the work for us. TAing over the summer is extremely rewarding, more fun than during the regular semester, and is a great way to get started if you’re interested in teaching. Qualifications include the following:

- Must be willing to dedicate 20 hours/week (25 hours/week if you're new, since you’ll also have to take CS 375).
- Must be in Berkeley from 6/20 (6/13 if you’re new, for orientation purposes) to 8/12 and available to teach four days a week.
- Must fulfill all of the other department requirements for TAs.
- Must like kids.

If you’re still interested, please fill out the following form by this Sunday, 1/31: http://goo.gl/forms/alstwgyNfO

Marvin and I will be sorting through these responses as they come in, and we’ll email you if you’re selected for an interview. Interviews will begin on February 1st. If you have any questions about the hiring process or the position, email us at brian.hou@berkeley.edu and zhangmarvin@berkeley.edu.
history.subject: CS 61A Summer 2016
